summary: The 'Keeping Drugs Out of Schools Act of 2025' authorizes grants to eligible entities, specifically Drug-Free Communities funded coalitions, for implementing school-community partnerships to prevent substance use and misuse among youth. The bill defines key terms, sets grant limits ($75,000 per year), allows for renewal grants, and outlines application procedures including the requirement of a detailed prevention plan. It also details the permitted use of funds and mandates an evaluation component. The bill authorizes appropriations of $7,000,000 annually from 2026-2031, with a maximum of 8% allocated for administrative costs.
